meanings.definition: A person who queries or asks questions.
meanings.sent1: The queriers in the classroom always raise their hands to ask questions.
meanings.sent2: The queriers at the town hall meeting had many inquiries for the speaker.
meanings.sent3: The queriers at the library were like curious detectives searching for answers.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a room full of queriers, each one eager to uncover the truth.
meanings.sent5: The queriers in the group discussion were like bright stars, illuminating new perspectives.

meanings.sent1: The book club members were avid queriers, always discussing the latest reads.
meanings.sent2: The queriers gathered around the table, eager to share their thoughts.
meanings.sent3: The queriers at the debate club meeting were like a flock of curious birds.
meanings.sent4: The room was filled with queriers, each one adding a unique perspective to the conversation.
meanings.sent5: The queriers in the group project were like puzzle pieces, fitting together to find the solution.
